edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models
Class Edge

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models.ObservableModel
          edu.belmont.mth.visigraph.models.Edge

public class Edge
extends ObservableModel

The Edge class represents the second of the two fundamental mathematical elements in a graph along with vertices. Edges can be used to define relationships between vertices, which together join to form a graph.

As an ObservableModel, this class supports multiple subscribing Observers. Whenever a change is made to any of its properties, notification of that change is automatically propagated upwards until it hits the Graph level and triggers a Observable.notifyObservers(Object) call.

Author:
Cameron Behar
See Also:
Graph}, {@link Vertex}, {@link Caption}

toString()
Method Detail

fixHandle

public void fixHandle()
Resets this Edge's handle to the midpoint of the line between its vertices when this Edge is linear, or to a user-specified relative location when it is a loop

getArc

public java.awt.geom.Arc2D getArc()
Returns this Edge's arc as an Arc2D. If this Edge is not an arc, this method will return the last valid arc before the Edge became linear.

Returns:
an Arc2D representing this Edge's arc
See Also:
#getCenter()}, {@link #getLine()}

getCenter

public java.awt.geom.Point2D getCenter()
Returns a Point2D representing the center of this Edge's arc-circle. If this Edge is not an arc, this method will return the last valid center before the Edge became linear.

Returns:
a Point2D representing the center of this Edge's arc-circle
See Also:
#getArc()}, {@link #getLine()}

getHandlePoint2D

public java.awt.geom.Point2D getHandlePoint2D()
Returns the location of this Edge's handle as a Point2D in the (x, -y) coordinate space

Returns:
a Point2D representing this Edge's handle in the (x, -y) coordinate space
See Also:
#handleX}, {@link #handleY}

getLine

public java.awt.geom.Line2D getLine()
Returns this Edge's line as a Line2D. If this Edge is not linear, this method will still return a line segment representing this Edge, were it in fact linear.

Returns:
a Line2D representing this Edge's line
See Also:
#getArc()}, {@link #getCenter()}

isAdjacent

public boolean isAdjacent(Edge edge)
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the specified Edge is adjacent to this Edge. Two edges are said to be adjacent to each other if they share at least one common vertex.

Parameters:
edge - the Edge to which to compare vertices for coincidence
Returns:
true the specified Edge is adjacent to this Edge, false otherwise

isLinear

public boolean isLinear()
Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the this Edge is to be treated as a straight line segment between its two vertices.

Returns:
true if this Edge is straight, false otherwise

refresh

public void refresh()
Recalculates this Edge's line and determines its linearity before making calls to update the arc, if necessary.

See Also:
#getLine()}, {@link #isLinear()}, {@link #getArc()}

straighten

public void straighten()
Repositions this Edge's handle so that the edge is a straight line segment between its two vertices, provided they are not the same (i.e. the edge is a loop).

suspendNotifications

public boolean suspendNotifications(boolean suspend)
Temporarily suspends the notification all of property changes to subscribed Observers. Most often this method is called when performing a large number of batch operations on an edge, so that subscribers are not overloaded with a multitude of notifications.

Parameters:
suspend - a boolean indicating whether to suspend or reenable notifications to subscribed Observers
Returns:
true if notifications were previously suspended, false otherwise
See Also:
ObservableModel}, {@link Observer}, {@link ObservableList}

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this edge in JSON format. This method can be used to serialize a edge, which may later be deserialized using the class's string constructor. For more information on the JSON format (used throughout VisiGraph for serialization), visit here.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

#Edge(String)
